intro: Changiodendron guangxiense, commonly known as Guangxi stonecress, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Guangxi region of China. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and the plant produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds.
